result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Jermaine Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.24.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.24.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.24.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.24.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to  Drug Abuse Correctional Center Attn. Stephanie P.O.Box 36 Winnebago WI 54985.

- signed and filed.  
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing 06/24/2015 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Mario Jermaine Fields in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO COURT FILE. AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a Misd.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 99 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months in the HOC concurrent.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.24.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.24.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,

  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 7.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Paul A. Oberer in court, defendant Mario Jermaine Fields not in court, in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference and bail bond heairng in Branch 7.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 04-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Mario Jermaine Fields in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Defendant Mario Jermaine Fields in custody.  Ron Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #1997CF4850 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Richard Fredericks-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court Commissioner Patrice Baker declines no contact order provided to the Court at this time due to no mention of person in the criminal complaint.

The court advised this is a praxis bail recommendation.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mario Jermaine Fields in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Mario Jermaine Fields in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
